basics.name: Konrad Odell
basics.label: Engineering Leader | Data Platforms & AI Integration
basics.summary: 20+ years building and leading distributed systems teams. Expertise in monolith decomposition, data lakehouse architecture, and translating AI capabilities into measurable business outcomes.

skills.name: Cloud
keywords: AWS (API Gateway, Lambda, EKS, RDS, S3)

work.name: Moxe Health
work.summary: Architect for B2B healthcare data interchange platform, focused on data platform capabilities and cross-team technical coordination.
highlights: Partnered on Databricks implementation including Unity Catalog governance, lakehouse architecture, and self-service tooling for data analysis
Built Databricks Genie interfaces enabling non-engineering teams to query complex healthcare datasets through natural language
Migrated ~600 TB clinical data to Trino+Iceberg lakehouse, replacing $14M/yr legacy vendor dependency
Led consent-management service team (Java, Spring Boot, NATS) with zero-downtime blue/green deployment
Validated AI opportunities including multimodal LLM proof-of-concept that identified $300K in recoverable invoices
Established integration testing patterns with canary deployment, smoke tests, and auto-rollback
Documented module boundaries and state diagrams for monolith decomposition planning on core clinical data processing system
Coordinated architecture decisions across Data Platform, Chart Retrieval, and RevOps teams

work.name: Cognizant Softvision → Discover Financial Services
work.summary: Built card-tracking API ingesting USPS and internal events on Spring Boot microservices in Agile environment.
highlights: Introduced contract-test pipeline (WireMock + Pact) to catch breaking API changes pre-production
Partnered with DevOps on Helm-based release process, reducing deploy time from 40 to 8 minutes
Mentored junior engineers on testing practices and senior engineers on cross-team communication

work.name: Nearstar Inc.
work.position: Senior Software Engineer → VP of Research
work.summary: Legacy modernization, Docker adoption, CI/CD implementation, and performance optimization.
highlights: Dockerized monolith suite enabling per-customer configuration and SaaS pivot
Optimized multithreaded PDF loader during COVID spike: +260% throughput, backlog cleared in 36 hours
Designed zero-downtime patch mechanism using Jenkins-orchestrated blue/green deployment
Migrated Windows servers to Linux (MariaDB), enabling zero-downtime deployments and improved performance

work.name: ClubCorp
work.summary: Mainframe to Oracle migration; built authentication framework with salted password hashing.

projects.name: AI Development Tools
projects.summary: Extensive use of Claude Code for autonomous development workflows, tool integration, and codebase analysis. Personal project experience with multi-model routing and structured output extraction.

projects.name: SchoolBrain
projects.summary: School organization app for parents with PostgreSQL streaming replica, OAuth, and Gemini-powered structured data extraction.

projects.name: RecipeBrain
projects.summary: Meal planning application with semantic search vectors and LLM-powered recipe parsing.

projects.name: Interactive Visualizers
projects.summary: Sort algorithm and pathfinding visualizers built with TypeScript and Three.js.
